pageTitle: UNESCO Culture Sector - Intangible Heritage - 2003 Convention :
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {18419=Vous êtes ici : UNESCO » Culture » Intangible Heritage » General Assembly » 4.GA - June 2012, 3895=The fourth session of the General Assembly of the States Parties to the Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage took place from 4 to 8 June 2012 at UNESCO Headquarters (7, place de Fontenoy, Paris 75007, Room II)., 3590=During this session, the General Assembly revised some of the Operational Directives in the light of the experience gained by the Intergovernmental Committee in their implementation since 2008. Revision proposals concerned the modalities of the examination and the maximum ceiling of files to be treated annually by the Committee. The General Assembly also proceeded with accreditation of non-governmental organizations for advisory services to the Committee and conducted an election for the renewal of half of the Members of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {45159=Conditions générales d'utilisation : Terms of use — Name and logo — Contact us — Sitemap — © UNESCO 1995-2012}
textBeforeTable: Agenda and documents Resolutions: English|French|Spanish|Russian|Arabic|Chinese Summary records (presented in June 2014): English|French List of participants: English/French Participants, summary records and resolutions Mr Toshiyuki Kono, Chairperson of the third General Assembly: English Ms Irina Bokova, Director-General of UNESCO: Multilingual H.E. Ms Alissandra Cummins, Chairperson of the Executive Board: English H.E. Ms Katalin Bogyay, President of the General Conference: English Speeches Rapporteur: Mr Dries Willems (Belgium) Vice-Chairs: France, Honduras, China, Burkina Faso, Lebanon Chairperson: H.E. Ms Eleonora Husseinova (Azerbaijan) Chairperson, Vice-Chairs and Rapporteur During this session, the General Assembly revised some of the Operational Directives in the light of the experience gained by the Intergovernmental Committee in their implementation since 2008. Revision proposals concerned the modalities of the examination and the maximum ceiling of files to be treated annually by the Committee. The General Assembly also proceeded with accreditation of non-governmental organizations for advisory services to the Committee and conducted an election for the renewal of half of the Members of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding
